qas.question: What is the official language of the Czech republic?
How long has the Czech Republic been a member of the European Union?
What distinction does Czech have in Slovakia?
Who collected data on language knowledge in Europe for the 2012 European Day of Languages?
Of the five countries with the greatest use of Czech, which country had the lowest percent of use?
How long has Slovakia been a member of the EU?
What group is German an official language of?
What survey showed German as the foreign language used most often in Poland?
What did the EU collect for the European Day of Languages in 2004?
What percentage of people in Portugal speak German?

context: <a0_0>Czech<a0_0/>, the official language of the Czech Republic (a member of the European Union <a1_0><b5_0>since 2004<b5_0/><a1_0/>), is one of <b6_0>the EU's<b6_0/> official languages and the 2012 <b7_0>Eurobarometer survey<b7_0/> found that Czech was the <a2_0>foreign language most often used<a2_0/> in Slovakia. Economist <a3_0>Jonathan van Parys<a3_0/> collected <b8_0>data on language knowledge<b8_0/> in Europe for the 2012 European Day of Languages. The five countries with the greatest use of Czech were the Czech Republic (98.77 percent), Slovakia (24.86 percent), Portugal (<b9_0>1.93 percent<b9_0/>), Poland (0.98 percent) and <a4_0>Germany<a4_0/> (0.47 percent).
